Articles.Content: Will it at all realistically possible to make a mobile port for KSP, so that I can take my kerbals with me on my android tablet?

Well BrokenArrow, Unity3D on which KSP is built, can create games for iOS and Android, but whether such devices are capable of running a game like KSP I do not know

I am pretty sure that Squad have no plans for mobile versions at least until after the 1.0 release of the game.
A 2D version for our smartphones would be nice, but I'd like the real version to be completed first.

A 2D version for our smartphones would be nice, but I'd like the real version to be completed first.

How exactly would a 2D version work..? Space is inherently 3D, and it seems to me it would be garbage and way to arcadey if it were 2D.
Bluejayek, if you look at some of HarvesteR's old blog posts you'll see that KSP was originally a 2D physics game with 3D graphics, the 3D physics came later

We are talking about playing KSP on phones in the first place... it's not like I really care how realistic the game since I wouldn't play with it for more than 5-10 minutes at a time. 2D would be the best for the phones both computing wise and for gameplay feel.

I heard an idea to be able to build rockets in the VAB with you mobile device and then launch them on the computer. Not sure where I heard it, but I don't see how a full game mobile version would work.
